Line 166: Line 166:
==Athletics==
==Athletics==
{{main article|UC Santa Barbara Gauchos}}
{{main article|UC Santa Barbara Gauchos}}
â
[[Image:UCSBswooshlogo.PNG|thumb|right|The UCSB Gauchos]]
 
The mascot of UCSB is the [[Gaucho]] and the school colors are blue and gold. UCSB's sports teams compete in the [[Big West Conference]], with the exception of the men's and women's water polo teams and the men's volleyball team, which are in the [[Mountain Pacific Sports Federation]]. Santa Barbara is best known for its women's [[basketball]] and [[UCSB soccer|men's soccer]] teams. In 2006, UCSB won their first NCAA Men's Soccer title and its second overall NCAA championship (1979 water polo) in school history.<ref name="ncaas">{{Cite web|url=http://www.ncaasports.com/soccer/mens/recaps/d1_1203_517049/2006|title=UC Santa Barbara 2, UCLA 1|accessdate=September 16 2007|dateformat=mdy|publisher=NCAA sports.com|year=2006|author=NCAA sports.com}}</ref><ref>
The mascot of UCSB is the [[Gaucho]] and the school colors are blue and gold. UCSB's sports teams compete in the [[Big West Conference]], with the exception of the men's and women's water polo teams and the men's volleyball team, which are in the [[Mountain Pacific Sports Federation]]. Santa Barbara is best known for its women's [[basketball]] and [[UCSB soccer|men's soccer]] teams. In 2006, UCSB won their first NCAA Men's Soccer title and its second overall NCAA championship (1979 water polo) in school history.<ref name="ncaas">{{Cite web|url=http://www.ncaasports.com/soccer/mens/recaps/d1_1203_517049/2006|title=UC Santa Barbara 2, UCLA 1|accessdate=September 16 2007|dateformat=mdy|publisher=NCAA sports.com|year=2006|author=NCAA sports.com}}</ref><ref>
